# AES-GCM

Authentication and encryption go hand in hand.

![](image-kl110ma2.png)

![](image-kl1116u2.png)

But MAC schemes were not designed for confidentiality, so the tag $t$ might leak some bits from the plaintext.

![](image-kl113i9q.png)

Better.

But there are specialized ones too.

![](image-kl114wez.png)

The largest in the world.

![](image-kl11780r.png)

Similar to CHACHA20. IVs should not be repeated. Probability of repeating when random is very small.

Unlike CBC encryption, CTR encryption is parallelizable. You can compute the counter offset before hand. $AES^{-1}$ is not used.
